Can't have second lunch without dessert, right?
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
Jenny was not kidding about her hunger. Somehow, after only just having a huge lunch - a normal lunch, in her eyes - over forty minutes ago, she was practically ravenous! The first tray hadn't even touched the table before she greedily grabbed a burger and fries off of it and tore in.

Anne, seeing how starving her poor little girl was, knew that just one tray wasn't going to sate her. She'd have to do another tour of the food court.
Not that it bothered her at all. Sure, her daughter's healthy appetite was a bit of a strain on her wallet, but her job paid well, and of course she was going to make sure her little Jen-Jen was always well fed and happy!

And so, off she went. She had already given Jenny a McDonalds, but she'd have to get something else to her before she finished. KFC would be a good next stop.

And just as Jenny finished her burger and large fries from McDonalds, a hefty helping of chicken, fries and gravy was plopped in front of her by her mother. She slurped a thanks before tearing into her second course.
But her lunch didn't stop there, of course. Burger King, Subway, Taco Bell and every other variety the food court had to offer was on Jenny's menu once again.

Some customers glanced over in amazement, some in concern, as Jenny gobbled up every scrap of food in front of her. She wolfed down every burger, poured every box and baggie of fries into her mouth, emptied every cup of soda, demolished every burrito, inhaled every sandwich, and even drank the remains of her KFC gravy straight from the tub!

Just how much could one little girl eat?!
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: Embodiment of Gluttony

choices: In school the next day, Jenny's increased appetite can't be sated...
Anne attempts to find new ways to deal with her enormous daughter.
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
How much could one little girl eat?

That question was on every mind in the food court- servers, customers, even Anne to some extent. It manifested in those who stared, rapt, at Jenny's glutting, and those who tried their hardest to look politely away. Some posted it on Snapchat or Twitter, others simply filed it for later, but it was a room-wide wonder- some even sure that the girl herself would end up room-wide.

The answer was a lot.

Forkful after forkful, fry after fry, calorie upon calorie upon incredibly fattening calorie all disappeared down Jenny's throat into her ravenous belly. She ate like she had not eaten in days despite it only having been minutes, frantically stuffing herself fuller and fuller to try to appease the yawning pit of her stomach. Tray after tray were entirely cleaned of all sustenance, only to be quickly replaced by a terrifically hurried Anne. More and more she ate, testing the mettle of her newly-purchased clothes both by size and sauce. But, as with all things, it eventually ended. After running (figuratively) the gamut of all eight restaurants, Jenny delicately plucked the final french fry from the final tray, stuffed it in her mouth, said "Thank you," belched the loudest belch anyone watching had ever heard, and fell right to sleep.

Anne, out several hundreds of dollars in food and having to deal with an impossibly fat, very asleep daughter, was somewhat at a loss.

There appeared to be no way to move Jenny from her chair- she was far too fat for the fairly small Anne to lift, much less move, and several light prods to her swollen belly yielded nothing more than a shift in weight and an alarming creak from the chair. She was all to aware of the eyes on her, eyes filled with judgement and malice, yet she had no way to remove herself or her fat, bloated daughter, who was even now bulging out of her new clothes, leaving several inches of vast belly on display for the judging eyes to judge further. In an attempt to remain composed, she cleaned up the detritus of her daughter's second lunch, tossing fourteen trays' worth of trash into the bins, but even then the others still watched, wondering, hating. Desparate for some absolution, Anne faced the crowd, trying to speak, to explain, to apologize. But, in the face of all those eyes, she could say nothing. She sunk down into a chair, defeated, and hid her face. Jenny, oblivious, slept on.

________________________________

This scene remained, unchanging, for nearly half an hour. Jenny slept, dreaming lightly of food and food by-products, sauce stains drying on her massive new shirt. Anne sat next to her, hunched over the greasy table, head buried in her hands. She was mortified- so rarely in her life had she been noticed for anything, but then all eyes were on her- and in the worst way possible. She didn't know what to do...

However, quiet self-reflection, even under the worst of circumstances, often yields good thoughts, and this was no exception. Anne sat bolt upright, fully stricken with her second idea of the day.

She needed a wheelchair.

And, luckily for her, there was a station for them just a few hundred feet from the table where Jenny slept.

Judging eyes forgotten, Anne leaped to her feet and headed for the mobility scooter parking area, and soon found one suitable for the task at hand. She drove it, rapidly, back to Jenny, parked it next to her overly-fattened daughter, and stood up, earning even more irate glares from the judgmental ones.

She may not be able to lift anything over 80 pounds, but, when it was in this form, she could rather easily push much more than that. So she did, and with a bit of good shoving she was able to situate her large daughter somewhat well on the seat of the scooter. Then, leaning over the controls, she drove her big little girl to the exit of the mall, and, with more shoving, was able to seat her in the sedan. She left the scooter there- somebody else could deal with it- and, finally, drove home. She wondered, and not for the last time, if she was doing the right thing. If all the judgmental looks in the mall were right, and she was wrong. Then, in the rear-view mirror, she caught a glimpse of Jenny's sleeping face. Stained though it was with food, and red though it was from exertion and sweat, she was still just the cutest thing Anne had ever seen.

Anne smiled, and drove on.
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: Jenny eventually finishes...and is sleepy from ...

choices: Katrina gives Jenny her lunch now, she'll be hungry later
Jenny has to tough out school with no food.
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
The next day, Jenny arrived in her classroom and sat down next to Katrina. Katrina took notice of Jenny's new clothes as well as her increased size. While the shirt fit, barely, it was strained to the max by Jenny's incredible belly. Said belly was the increase in size Katrina noticed earlier. The weight gained from Jenny's binge manifested itself soly on her tummy. The behemoth was a perfectly round ball that managed to defy gravity as it bulged out obscenely far from her with relatively little sag.

"Wow Jenny, you look...different" Katrina said. "Did you do something with your hair?"

Jenny giggled. "No, but I did get new clothes. What do you think?" she asked as she spun around. She tried to stop after one turn but the incredible mass called her belly forced her to turn once more before she was able to stop herself.

"I think you look good!" Katrina replied. Truthfully, it was just nice to see that tummy covered.

Just as she thought that, Jenny went pale and gripped her belly.

"Uh oh" Jenny mumbled as she continued to rub her huge orb.

"Jenny are you okay?" Katrina asked. She was genuinely concerned for her friend. Was she having a heart attack? Was she going to throw up?

Jenny shook her head no as a powerful growl tore through her belly and visibly rippled the orb and caused the shirt to ride all the way up it's vast expanse. Jenny held her tummy as the growl continued at a very loud level, before quieting down to a series of gurgles before silence.

"That" Jenny said as she continued to sweat.

Katrina was just in awe. She had never heard a belly growl that loud before. And that was before class even started! Who knows how loud her belly could get by lunch time.

"You packed snacks and a lunch right?" Katrina asked her starving friend.

"I did but...I ate them all already" Jenny replied sadly as another growl visibly rippled her gut again.

Suddenly the teacher walked in and began the lesson. Class seemed to drag on and on . The entire time Jenny's belly was getting louder and louder. The rippling of her belly started to cause her desk to scoot away from her and push her chair backwards. All poor Jenny could do was rub her belly and hope that she could at least make it to the end of class so she could think of something.
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: In school the next day, Jenny's increased a...

choices: Dinner is ready!
At bedtime, Jenny's food-laden mind affects her dreams...
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
By the time Anne had pulled into the driveway, as if on miraculous cue, Jenny had begun to stir from her deep sleep. She grunted quietly, smacking her lips.

"Hey, honey," Anne said softly, knowing how sensitive her daughter was when just waking up, "we're home."
Another grunt sounded from the overfed girl, who rubbed her plump fists on her tired eyes. "Okay..."
The leaner woman got out and got to the side door, unbuckling Jenny's belt and letting her adjust herself so her thick legs dangled out. The girl's overindulged tummy, just barely fitting under her new shirt again, took up a good amount of her lap.

"Okay, Jen-Jen," Anne muttered, wrapping her arms around the girl's globular middle and feeling them squish into her love handles, "ready?"
Jenny simply flopped her flabby arms onto her mother's shoulders and lazily leaned against her. "Uh-huh..."
"Alright, one, two, three!" With as much care as she could muster, Anne heaved the (at least) three-hundred pounder off the seat and onto the ground. Both let out an exerted grunt when it was over; Anne from the sharp but temporary pain in her arms and back, and Jenny from being squished up and having to stand again. "Phew..."

"Thanks, mommy," Jenny muttered sleepily, still groggy from her nap, and sluggishly waddled toward the house with her mother's help.

-

"There you go, honeybun," Anne cooed, crouching down and setting a tall glass of orange soda on the little table next to Jenny, who was nestled comfortably into the side of the couch, in perfect view of the TV. The seat next to her was occupied by a large bag of BBQ chips and and a pair of sharing-size chocolate bars.
"Thanks, mommy," Jenny giggled, a lot more awake and happy now that she was back in her comfort zone. In fact, she actually mustered the energy to lean forward and give her mother a hug around her shoulders. "I love you so much!"
Anne's heart melted at the display of affection, and returned the hug before adding a loving kiss on her clean, chubby cheek. "I love you too, sweetie-pie."

With that, Anne got up and walked out of the living room, taking one last look at her daughter before going to the kitchen.
She sat at the table, and began to think.

She thought about back at the food court, most notably what Jenny had done there. Fourteen trays of food, all emptied into her daughter's mouth in one sitting. That was all just a second lunch!

The clothes she had bought just minutes before her daughter ate were already threatening to be outgrown. Though they looked more or less the same now, albeit with some dried stains, how long would it be until she outgrew that outfit?
And the looks she got... goodness, the people there were not impressed. All those scathing stares at her and her daughter for eating so much...

Though, as Anne leaned over to look through the doorways toward the couch, another thought came to her.

Even from there, she could see the brightness in Jenny's eyes. The gleam of innocent happiness in every child. Jenny seemed totally clueless about how big she was or how much she was eating; she was happy with her life.

Anne began to rationalise. There was nothing wrong with Jenny at all, or her upbringing. She was happy, and she just had a healthier appetite and bulkier build than most kids.
What did she care what strangers thought of her? How she raised her daughter was none of their business. Jenny was leading a happy, comfortable life, and she felt no need to take it away from her.

Besides, Jenny did have a lot of exercise today, so of course she was going to eat more than usual to balance it out. It made total sense, now that she thought about it!

She glanced up at the clock hanging on the kitchen wall, and she straightened up as she saw that it was nearly six in the evening.

Speaking of eating, Anne thought as she got up and went to the oven, better start on dinner!
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: The Decision

choices: At school, Jenny tells Katrina of her exciting day
Skip a while- Jenny's eating is starting to affect her mobility...
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
And so the pampering continued. Anne hustled and bustled in the kitchen, racing from cabinet to stove to countertop to fridge, preparing a casserole, a stew, and a stir-fry all at once. Spices flew, pots bubbled, and pans sizzled, all reminders that Anne needed to stir this, add that, and most certainly clean the kitchen later. She worked and worked and worked, tiring herself further after an already tiring day- but to her, it was all worth it. Anything was worth it to see Jenny happy.

Meanwhile, Jenny simply sat on the couch, idly eating her way through barbecue chips and watching a show on Nickelodeon. She was doing nothing to help, of course- she'd worked far too hard today for something like that- yet she was going to reap all the rewards, all the benefits, and simply go on getting larger. Even now, her massive second lunch was digesting, turning itself into more pounds for her already overburdened frame. Being dim, Jenny was not at all aware of the future consequences of how she ate, but if she kept up this pace she'd certainly see them before too long. But, as it was, these thoughts didn't bother her in the least, so she went on sitting and noshing.

Finally, after a fairly long amount of time during which Jenny successfully ate three family-sized bags of chips, Anne wearily called "Dinner is served!" and, when her bulgy daughter failed to make an appearance, went out in to the living room to help Jenny stand up. Anne strode quickly back to set the table, and Jenny, after a luxurious stretch, set off on the long waddle in the same direction. She made it, luckily for her grumbling stomach, and, with her mother's help, settled herself in a vastly overtaxed and overflowed chair. Jenny looked at her large dinner, forehead damp with sweat from her trek from couch to chair, and smiled. Anne smiled back.

It really was quite a lot of food- Anne had broken out the industrial cookware she had bought on a whim some years ago. Nearly two gallons of stew, a casserole dish four inches deep, and a pan as wide as Jenny's fat arm was long graced the table with their presence. Jenny, sniffing the air, was in heaven. And, with a great ladleful of stew, she began.

______________________

"I'm done, Mommy," said Jenny, letting her fork clatter to her plate. Somewhat surprisingly, she had not actually eaten everything, but she'd certainly eaten well over half of every dish. Anne, however, was pleased, because not only did it mean, to her slow brain, that her daughter was actually not fat (her not finishing, to Anne, looked like self-control, rather than fullness after eating four meals and countless snacks), it also meant that she could serve the leftovers as breakfast the next morning before school- she was, after all, so tired. So, without much further ado, she helped Jenny off the chair, up the stairs, and into her very undersized pajamas, and, leaving her to brush her teeth alone, went back downstairs to clean the kitchen and put the food away. After what seemed like forever, Anne finished that, turned off the lights, and, pausing briefly to help her flabby daughter into her bed, went into her own room, undressed, and crashed. Sleep, then, seemed like the best idea in the entire world.
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: Dinner is ready!

choices: Class begins...
Later, at lunchtime...
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
Katrina was happy, and more than a little relieved, to see Jenny waddle through the school gates. Since Jenny hadn't shown up at school yesterday, and she had collapsed after crushing a chair the day before that, she was worried her poor friend had hurt herself.

Rushing to her side - as much rushing as a rather portly girl like Katrina could do, at least - she exchanged a hug with her larger friend and dutifully helped her lumber toward the doors. She could see Jenny's round, pink face slowly turning red from tiredness at all the walking, so she'd have to be careful.

Luckily, the two made it to the classroom alright, and Jenny sat herself down at her desk, the new chair creaking ominously beneath her. It seemed her little fiasco the other day was just a fluke - the chair was particularly old, so of course the heavyset girl demolished it beneath her bulk.
Though, a thought in the back of Katrina's mind told her that it wouldn't be long before she crushed this chair too. She pushed the thought away, feeling bad for thinking that of her best friend.

When they got sat down, and Jenny had regained her breath, she was more than happy to recount how she'd spent her 'sick day' to Katrina. She talked about her new clothes, the adult clothes store, her two trips to the food court, and her great nap before dinner. Katrina stayed quiet, listening intently to her friend's story.

Did Jenny really outgrow the plus-size kids' store clothes? She really ate fourteen whole trays of food? And she really fell asleep right there in the food court?!

Though, Jenny didn't seem ashamed of it - she didn't seem to comprehend humiliation. She was just happy that she found some new clothes and got to eat some great food. Katrina had to admit, that was a really sweet outlook on the whole thing. Plus, it was refreshing to see her large friend had finally found a shirt that properly covered that massive tummy of hers!

Jenny was the fattest, dimmest and most innocent person Katrina had ever seen in her life. And she wouldn't have her any other way.

With that rationalisation, Katrina smiled at her best friend, glad that she had such a fun day. Except for all that walking around and trying on clothes - she felt bad about that mental image of her being so exhausted, and wished she could be there to help her get around. Perhaps next time.
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: Back to School

choices: Fortunately for Katrina, the afternoon passes without great incident.
Jenny's appetite is too much- the vending machine runs dry!
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
"Alright, class!" said Miss Forsythe, clapping her hands for their attention. "Today, we're going to start with a little math. Everybody get out your textbooks, we're going to dive right in to Chapter 7! Now, to warm up, who can tell me what 15 times 32 is?"

Jenny's head lolled slightly, bored already with only thirty seconds of instruction. Her chins squished together as she looked around, eyes lazily flitting from one object to the next. She drummed her chubby fingers on her very chubby belly, anxious for any sort of distraction. The class turned their pages, so she, rather startled, did too, anxious to not be noticed as distracted. A quick look at the book yielded nothing of interest except a picture of ice cream in one corner. Ice cream...mmm...I haven't had any in quite a while... she mused to herself, glancing around the room again. The clock told her only that ten minutes had passed. Disappointed, she resumed thinking about ice cream, but, in doing so, she realized that she was somewhat peckish. No, hungry. No, RAVENOUS!

Her belly, always helpful in these endeavors, growled quite loudly.

Katrina looked in shock at her best friend. Usually she started to crave snacks at about 11, then again at 1, but NEVER at 8:45 in the morning! Jenny looked, mildly surprised, at her belly, but then turned her gaze to Katrina and nodded slightly, setting her face jiggling. Katrina looked at her, then at the teacher, then at Jenny again, and raced off to find snack foods. Katrina suspected this would not be the last snack run of the day.

_____________________________________

And she was right. Katrina had been rather put to work- not a good state for the very pudgy girl. She had been forced to make a snack run every hour, and sometimes twice in one! Miss Forsythe looked more and more irritated every time she left the room, so it was a lucky thing for both Jenny and Katrina that lunch had finally arrived. The two girls had learned from their previous lunch troubles, and this time spent both lunch and recess firmly planted in the cafeteria, consuming large homemade lunches and then several platters of school food- Jenny, of course, more so, but Katrina had herself eaten quite a bit. Even so, Katrina was somewhat worried- Jenny always seemed to get hungry in the afternoon, despite lunch, and she was sure today would be no exception. Would the vending machine even be enough for the ravenous Jenny?
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: Class begins...

choices: School is out, and Anne has come to the same conclusion...
Jenny falls asleep in class? She has Gym? Anything at all?
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
Fortune seemed to be on Katrina's side after lunch. Aside from her usual 1pm snack craving that was satisfied by a few chocolate bars from the vending machine, Jenny's belly seemed to be appeased. At least for now.
Its owner was sat at her desk, slightly squeezed into it, and actually able to focus on her work. Well, as much as her attention span would let her.

Katrina, as usual, worked dutifully and focused on what the teacher was saying about grammar. She shot a glance to her larger friend, and she just had to wonder - why did Jenny's belly go off so early in the morning?
Perhaps she didn't eat a big enough breakfast? Perhaps she was particularly hungry earlier?

Maybe she did so much walking around, the exercise threw her appetite out of whack? She mused, the tiniest of smirks on her plump face at the innocent, silent jab at her friend as she faced down at her workbook.

Though, now that she thought about it, that notion didn't sound too ridiculous. This was Jenny she was thinking about, after all.
Maybe her body got confused by all that exercise yesterday and messed with her appetite, and now that she was in her normal routine, things were balancing back out?
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: Back to Normal...?

choices: On the way home, Anne sees a billboard for mobility scooters and is inspired.
Anne can't figure it out, and leaves the girls to play while she thinks it over.
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
As Anne watched her daughter struggle to waddle the few steps to the car, even supported, she reflected on the events of the previous day. It had taken absolute mountains of food to feed her daughter in the afternoon, but she needed less for dinner than she had originally expected. Then, she needed less than even what was normal for breakfast, but apparently (according to a call from her teacher) needed snacks in first period- but then returned to normal after that. Anne couldn't figure it out, and worried somewhat that the normal quantity of after-school snacks wouldn't be enough for her...

But, as the two girls tore into their snacks as per usual, Anne relaxed slightly. Jenny didn't seem to be the mindless food machine she had been yesterday, taking time in between burgers to engage in conversation, and Anne arrived at the same conclusion Katrina had, hours earlier- that Jenny's monumental belly had just been thrown off by the strenuous excercise of the previous day. But, now that Anne knew that, she resolved that Jenny should never again have to experience such an upset to her daily diet again. But how? she wondered, driving onwards. How?
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: School is out, and Anne has come to the same co...

choices: At home, Anne checks the website...
Another solution shows itself?
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
For the first time in a long time, Anne was grateful to be stuck at some traffic lights. It gave her some time to think about what she had been mulling over the entire drive.

How could she get Jenny around outside of home and school without subjecting her to so much exercise that her appetite got thrown off balance?

As her eyes wandered through the door window, and landed on a billboard hanging on the side of a building. The large image of a sleek mobility scooter had caught her eye, along with the bullet points next to it.

EasyGo Mobility Scooters
The best and safest in disabled transportation!
Available in (and supports) all sizes!
Visit our website for more details

Of course! Anne nearly slapped her forehead at the simple and perfect solution. A mobility scooter would do wonders for long days outside! It had worked wonders in the mall, after all.
Jenny could go wherever she wanted, and be completely comfortable all the while!

With no hesitation, Anne took down the website on her phone for later, and drove on.
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: A New Mode of Transport

choices: Anne scrimps, scrounges, and saves, and is able to get enough for the scooter.
Anne can't find the funds- Jenny will struggle, even as her weight climbs higher
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
After making sure that both girls were well-situated on the couch and equipped with plenty of snacks, Anne hurried to her office and booted her computer, eager to find out more about scooters for her mobility-challenged little girl. She resolved that her cute little daughter would no more have to burden herself with long walks, nor worry that there was any place she could not go. For, whatever the place, her all-new, battery-powered transport would get her there. She could see it now- her Jen-Jen, no longer encumbered with walking, happy as a clam and free as a bird. Everywhere would be open to her, everything would be-

Hold on, it cost fifteen hundred dollars?

Anne, incredulous, refreshed the page. The offending price tag remained, taunting her with its wallet-busting largeness. And that was just the starter model- a few clicks more revealed that the higher-end and larger-load-bearing models only climbed in price. And, on top of that, Anne slowly began to realize that she would have to make some rather extreme modifications to her minivan in order to fit the scooter inside, which would undoubtedly raise the price still further. There was no way she could afford this.

She leaned back, sighed deeply and with great aggrevation, and cursed, quietly, her circumstances in life.

But, then, she took a look outside her room, at the two friends watching television. It seemed that Jenny had run out of chips and was trying, desparately, to stand, huffing and puffing and pushing herself forward, all to no avail. Katrina stood up and tried to assist her, but even then could not pull her massive friend off the sagging couch. Finally, with a sigh of mild exasperation, Katrina stalked away into the kitchen, and Jenny, sheepishly, licked the crumbs off her hands.

Maybe, thought Anne sadly, watching her daughter's struggles to move, maybe we can find the money somewhere.
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: At home, Anne checks the website...

choices: Jenny has somehow maintained a steady size in the past months...
Jenny has grown, of course!
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
The next few months were not easy for Anne. She had decided that, when it came to her daughter's happiness, money was no object. She'd use every penny she had if it was to make her little Jen-Jen happy.

And she was going to put that promise to practice.

Every penny she made at work, small odd jobs on the side, and selling off a few trinkets around the house that wouldn't be missed, she put toward Jenny's scooter fund. She had even managed to get a raise at her job, which certainly helped.

Another miracle was that the minivan modifications that she dreaded turned out to be not as costly as she'd imagined - after some browsing around, she came to the conclusion that simply having the backseats modified to go forward and back, like the driver's seat, would be the best solution. And a local service could do it for a reasonable price!

Though, despite the lucky breaks, it would still take a few months for the scooter itself to be paid for, considering the extra-strength model she had decided on clocked in at just under two thousand dollars.

But it was all worth it. Anne couldn't help herself from smiling as she loaded Jenny into the modified minivan on the big day.

Jenny was a little confused and groggy from not being awake for too long, on top of her normally hearty breakfast, but she could still somehow muster some excitement when her mom told her she was getting a present!
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: A Brand New Toy!

choices: Jenny tests it out- it works great!
Unfortunately, Anne will have to upgrade- this one folds under Jenny like paper.
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
"Where...where are we going, Mom?" asked Jenny groggily, rubbing her tired eyes. "It's a little late for school...isn't it?"

"Just wait and see, dear! We'll be there shortly!" Anne said cheerily, stepping on the gas slightly.

"Alright..." said Jenny, somewhat disconsolately. Her belly, similarly disconsolate, let out a small groan. Jenny pressed her hands to it. "I'm hungry..."

"But, dear!" Anne said, exasparatedly. "You just ate breakfast!"

"I know, but that was an hour ago... and I did have to walk all the way to the car..."

"Ugh, fine," groaned Anne, "but we'll have to be fast, okay honey? I don't want to be too late."

"Yay!" said Jenny happily, setting her entire body into motion. "I want six hamburgers- no, seven- and twenty nuggets, and a chicken sandwich, and four large fries, and..."

Anne could almost hear her wallet crying out in pain as her daughter's order grew longer and longer. She just hoped that this second breakfast would be enough to hold Jenny through the next few hours- and, more worryingly, whether the mobility scooter they were going to get would be enough to hold Jenny.

For Jenny had done nothing in the previous few months but grow, and grow, and grow. She had gone from at least three hundred pounds to most definitely four hundred, and it showed. Jenny was outgrowing clothes nearly as fast as her mother could get more, which meant that most of the time at least some portion of her belly, if not the whole thing, was left on display by her tentlike-yet-undersized clothes. Her belly, in particular, was really quite something- it had reached past her knees and slapped against her legs whenever she walked, and when she sat in low seats, as she did now, it nearly touched the floor. The rest of her had not neglected to gain, either- her butt had grown to such a size that she now needed two chairs whenever she sat so as to evenly spread the weight. Up above, her chest had blossomed early, growing so that Anne was seriously considering buying her a bra. She was now well on her way, as well, to developing a third chin. Anne, looking at her daughter's vast belly swinging gently just above the floor, thought that this scooter could not have been better timed.

Jenny's mobility had, naturally, also taken a hit. Now, even with Katrina's help, she could barely make it to her next classes, let alone outside- they would sometimes have to take three breaks for Jenny to be able to make it all the way. Anne was not even sure if she could walk on her own now- she figured, with all the pampering she was getting, that it was unlikely. In fact, she was sure she couldn't- she could hear her daughter wheezing slightly from the effort of just sitting. As she listened, and watched her daughter's huge body jiggle, she felt nothing but love. She would make sure her daughter would never have to worry again.

_________________________

After what seemed a short drive to Anne and interminable to Jenny, the van pulled into the parking lot of EasyGo Mobility Scooters. As was usual, Anne hopped out of the car and proceeded to help Jenny get out- a task, she soon realized, that would soon enough be over. Jenny, however, took no notice of the sign, so tired was she from the effort of standing up. Anne, curious to see whether her daughter was even the slightest bit capable, walked on ahead. Jenny, after a few minutes rest, realized she had been left behind, and so, mustering all of her strength, swung her enormous body entirely to one side, thereby moving one fat foot forwards. Then, she did it again, and a third time, then a fourth- then, leaned up against the car again, wheezing loudly in distress. Anne, realizing the ordeal she had put her daughter through, ran back, wiped her sweaty forehead, apologized profusely, and helped her onward.
_________________________

Finally, Jenny and Anne were standing inside the air-conditioned lobby of the scooter store, one wheezing. the other greeting the rather baffled salesman. "I trust you have my purchase ready?" Anne asked the man somewhat frostily. He, anxious to avoid the weird mother and her freakily fat kid, hurried off to retrieve it. Anne helped Jenny to a bench, and when the young girl recovered her breath, she asked, "Mommy, why are we here?"

"Well-" started Anne, but the rearrival of the salesman interrupted her.

"The Chairman Deluxe, just like you requested, ma'am!" he said perkily.

Jenny stared, wide-eyed, at what was to become her new seat. Anne kissed her lightly on one fat cheek.

"I hope you like it," she said.

"Oh, I will," Jenny replied.
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: Jenny has grown, of course!

choices: Jenny wants to go test it out some more! Perhaps the mall? Or the park?
Does something else happen?
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
Jenny kept her wide-eyed excitement as she asked, "Can I try it out?"
"Of course you can, honey," Anne said with a nod.

After quite a bit of effort, on Jenny's and Anne's parts, the massively overweight girl managed to get herself seated onto the Chairman Deluxe. To Anne's surprise and delight, not only did she not hear a single creak from the sturdy machine, but the seat managed to fit Jenny's large rear perfectly!
Her enormous, ticklish tummy made contact with the scooter's cold floor, invoking a small round of giggling.

The salesman, reluctant as he was, braved walking over to show the chubby child how the machine worked.
"You turn the key here to switch it on," he explained, "and you twist the handle here to go. Got that?"
Jenny managed a small nod, despite her treble chin. "That sounds easy..."

She followed the instructions, turning on the scooter's engine. It was quiet, almost silent, and when she turned the handle to go at a leisurely slow pace, the scooter ran smoothly, the four hundred pounds piled onto it not hindering its performance one bit.

Smiles went across all three faces in the room.

"Thank you so much," Anne sighed with relief, "you got the payment, right?"
"Yes, it's all gone through," the salesman nodded and picked up a small set of sheets, "just a few forms to sign, and you're all set. Just insurance and such."

Anne happily sat down at the bench and signed, taking occasional glances up to see her daughter enjoying her new toy.

Not only would Jenny be nice and comfortable anywhere she went, her appetite incident at the mall would never happen again!
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.title: Success!

choices: In the park, Jenny sees somebody she knows.
The park has a lake- Jenny wants to go for a swim!
1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
"Well, dearest, how is it? Do you like it?" asked Anne, holding the door open for her enormous little girl.

"Oh, I love it!" said Jenny cheerfully, trundling on through. "It's gonna make everything so much easier. Oh, Katrina is gonna be so jealous!"

Privately, Anne worried for her big daughter. Not that she was so fat she now needed a scooter to move- no, nothing so ridiculous. Anne feared, instead, that the other children would make fun of her, or otherwise cause her trouble- maybe they'd mess with her scooter so she can't get around? A terrifying image of Jenny, stranded in class, unable to get to the lunchroom, filled her mind. She gasped audibly.

"Mommy, what is it?" asked Jenny from her new seat. "Are you okay?"

With some difficulty, Anne managed to calm herself down and affix a smile onto her face. "Of course, Jen-Jen! I was just thinking."

"Oh, alright," said Jenny, driving up to the car. "Can we go have a snack now?"

Anne chuckled despite her fears. "Of course we can! Here, let's get you inside."

Jenny looked worriedly at the ground, but Anne patted her reassuringly on the shoulder. "No, no, don't worry- we've got a fix for that too."

Anne went to the trunk, and Jenny watched, amazed, as her mother lifted out a small, but sturdy ramp and set it down against the van. "Drive on in, honey!"

Jenny, in wonderment, did so, and with a few straps she was secured in the back of the car just as firmly as she would be in any other seat- with the added bonus that her new scooter did not pinch. "Mom, you're the BEST! Thank you so much!"

"Of course, dear," Anne said with a warm grin. "Where to?"

Jenny thought for a moment, then said "Wendys."

But, as the car started to move, Jenny cried out "Wait!"

Anne put on the brakes rather suddenly. "What is it, Jenny? Is everything alright?"

"I was wondering..." said Jenny slowly. Wondering was not a natural phenomenon in the big girl's head. "Can we also go to the park?"

Anne looked back at her daughter in surprise. "Why, of course! But why?"

She couldn't help but smile as Jenny leaned forward to grab her food, and had a wide grin on her chubby little face as she wolfed it down.

"Here we are, sweetie," Anne looked in her mirror at her daughter, "ready to go?"
"Uh-huh!" Jenny chirped, then let out a loud burp. She blushed and smiled awkwardly "Scuze me..."

Anne chuckled softly, happy that her daughter hadn't forgotten her manners. She got out, set up the ramp and unstrapped the scooter. "Okay, you know how to reverse?"
"I think so," Jenny muttered, her eyes locked on a setting with a big R next to it. She clicked it in and gingerly backed up.
"Easy now..." Anne murmured, making sure the scooter's wheels stayed on the ramp as they came down. "Nearly there... done! Well done, honey!" She beamed and gently kissed her on the flabby cheek.
Feeling proud of her successful first reverse, Jenny wore a grin on her fat face as she wheeled toward the park, Anne walking at a casual pace right next to her.

The park was as lively as ever, with people walking around on the paths or kids and dogs playing on the grass.
Jenny scooted along, happily oblivious to any turning heads and muffled voices in her wake. Anne wasn't so lucky, and just barely managed to keep her temper from flaring at the comments.

Jenny's eyes widened as something came into view - the park's lake! A large pond of clean water, which on a bright and sunny day like this, was perfect for swimming in. Many people and kids were taking advantage of the fact.
Seeing the kids splashing around in the water filled Jenny with an urge. "Mom, can I go swimming in the lake?"
Anne blinked, and looked at her daughter with genuine surprise. "What was that, hun?" She asked, not sure if she heard properly.
"It looks fun!" Her daughter grinned. "Can I? Please?"

Jenny's insistence to swim caught Anne off guard. After years of hearing how much of a pain P.E. is, she'd never dreamed her daughter would actually want to exercise!
But, then again, this was a great thing! Jenny was getting outside and playing! And it was a beautiful day, after all.
"Of course, dear!" She decided, and grabbed the hem of her daughter's shirt. "Arms up!"

It took quite a few minutes, but Jenny was finally stripped down to her underwear. The sight of her large chest made Anne's consideration for a bra even more assuring.

"Easy, hun," she muttered, and carefully lowered Jenny into the water with quite a splash, "there you go. Be careful now!"
"I will," Jenny sighed at her mom's worrying, and simply relaxed as she felt the cool water on her flabby body. The gentle waves of the lake bobbed her along the surface, and she allowed herself to float along with a contented sigh.

1121122112121111112111211211111121221121.content:
A few hours passed. Anne clicked, and clicked, and clicked, all the while seeming to get nowhere. No solution jumped out at her, no answer appealed to her. There seemed to be no way to keep her daughter safe from the perils of exercising, no way to be sure she was fed all the time, especially not since she was out of the house for seven hours a day anyway. Anne stole a glance into the living room, watching Jenny and Katrina giggle away the afternoon without a care in the world. Nothing seemed to bother them, not here at home, anyway. Here, they could just be kids, free from the perils of public education. A warm smile spread across Anne's face, and that old phrase her grandmother used to see finally made sense. Home really is where the heart is, she thought.

Something about that phrase was bothering her, though. Her face changed from a smile to a grimace to a frown as she thought harder and harder. Home is where the heart... Home is where... Home is...

Home.

"Home!" she said aloud, startled by her own thoughts. "I'll homeschool her!"

She pounced on the keyboard as a cat onto a mouse and frantically typed in "How to homeschool." This was the best idea she had ever had! Now, she could be assured that Jenny was always full and always safe, and always lavished with love of the kind sappy enough to be in a movie. Everything could be ordered online now anyways- why bother going shopping? And, for that matter, if Jenny was going to be at home all the time anyway, why even bother with clothes? In a way, this could save money- no more gasoline in going to stores, even food could be ordered online these days. Not once did the negative ramifications of being a hermit ever cross Anne's mind, naturally. In her frantic state there could be no negative ramifications. So she read, and read, and read, absorbing useful tidbit after useful tidbit as the afternoon creeped by. So engrossed was she that she nearly missed preparing dinner- only a distressed cry from Jenny and a similarly angry noise from Katrina bought her back to the present.

_________________________________

"Jenny," said Anne carefully, after Katrina had left, "school has been pretty hard for you lately, hasn't it?"

Anne pounced. "Jenny, what do you say to being homeschooled? You wouldn't have to burden yourself with anything- we can order everything here, and just have a lot of fun together, you and I. What do you think?"

"Uhh..." said Jenny, filled with confusion, "can...can I think about it? I really don't want to miss this episode, it's a very important one..."

"Fine," clucked Anne disappointedly, "but let me know, ok? It's a very important question!"

"I will, I will," huffed Jenny, waving one fat hand dismissively.

"Alright, sweetie," said Anne, smiling despite herself. "Tell me tomorrow, alright?" And, with a light kiss on the forehead, Anne left, leaving Jenny to her cartoons. As she ascended the stairs to her bedroom, she hoped it would work out for the better.

As Anne helped her bulgy daughter out of the van into Katrina's waiting arms, she couldn't help feeling somewhat unhappy about the whole arrangement. Even from her car, she could see Jenny's struggle to waddle the short distance to school- she leaned heavily on Katrina, and even then had to stop in the middle to lean on a column in the front and take a breather. Anne frowned and reluctantly pulled away, feeling helpless. She wanted nothing more than to rescue Jenny from all that difficulty- but how could she rescue someone who doesn't want to be rescued?

That question stuck with her all day- through her drive to work, through every email sent, phone call received, and associate met, and still she had nothing. There appeared to be no solution to her problem, only a circle which could not be broken. The problem could be simply put as follows:

1) Jenny is far too large to go to school.

2) Jenny cannot be without Katrina.

3) Katrina goes to school.

Therefore, 4) Jenny must go to school.

But...see number 1.

Anne could see no way around this. The only ways seemed to be if Jenny either lost weight- an involuntary shudder passed through her as she thought this- or if Katrina were somehow able to spend all day with Jenny...

Anne's eyes widened. Of course, how haven't I realized already! she thought to herself, smacking her steering wheel in annoyance-tinged triumph. Summer is coming!

Indeed it was- and, since summer was the school holiday, Katrina could probably sleep over ever day! Jenny would be in heaven, and Katrina would probably enjoy herself too! And, best of all, Anne wouldn't have to pose the question of homeschooling again until next school year, at which time Jenny would probably be too large to protest...

No, mustn't think that way, Anne chided herself, pushing those thoughts out of her mind. For now, she needed to focus on her new plan- getting Katrina to spend the summer with them.
