The Next Day at School
1443311.content:
Cali felt her hands scrape the bottom of the chip bag. The lack of chips made her frown and her belly cry loudly. She looked down at her tummy with a frown as she rubbed the orb and calmed it's temper tantrum. She got up and stared at her tummy some more, the frown slowly turning into a smile. She had made it so much bigger that there was no way she could stay mad at it. Her belly had become a huge orb that, if she were older, would have made her look 9 months pregnant with at least one baby, maybe two. She leaned back to compensate for her large tum and cupped her hands underneath. She lifted the great weight with a slight grunt and dropped it. After watching it bounce a few times before settling, a sharp growl reminded her of her mission. Her tummy voiced it's complaint about being played with and not fed.

"Playtime can wait, I'm hungry" her belly seemed to tell her.

Putting her hands on top of her behemoth tummy she started to drum her hands on top of hit and hummed a tune as she waddled her way down into the pantry.

"Big loud growl! My empty tummy's howl! The bigger she gets, the less my clothes fit! Soon it won't be covered even in a towel!" she sang to herself. "Hmm...Might need to work on that last part. What do you think big girl?" She asked her tummy. It gurgled a response, which she took as a "It's good, but still needs work." Cali giggled as she patted her tummy again before opening up the door and looking inside.

There was a right buffet in there. Anything she ever asked for was fully stocked. Cookies, chips, popcorn, everything! It made her jumbo-tum absolutely scream and writhe. Cali placed a hand on her belly to steady herself. She quickly grabbed some popcorn and ran back upstairs.
1443311.title: She waddles off for more snacks, while humming ...

choices: Cali dreams...a sweet dream or a sour nightmare?
Something else?
14433111.content:
Cali must have dozed off, because she jolted awake when she heard the front door closing. She was on her bed, a large bag of popcorn resting on her rounded middle. It was opened and empty, with a few crumbs dotted around her tummy. She giggled and picked them off before rolling off her bed and waddling downstairs.

A grin crossed her chubby face as she saw her parents were back. Her father was a rather slim man while her mother was quite a blubbery sphere of a woman. It was no secret where Cali got her appetite from.

"Hi, sweetheart!" Dad smiled, kneeling down to give her a hug. "Hungry?"
"Yeah!" She giggled, and her tummy even enforced her answer with a growl.
Her mom chuckled, sending her massive form jiggling, "Well, I hope you're in the mood for pizza!"

Cali's eyes widened and she nodded frantically.

After not too long, she was sitting at the dining room table with a large, incredibly cheesy pizza all to herself, while her mom had her own large one and a medium one was claimed by her dad. And of course, Cali had a whole tub of chocolate ice cream for dessert to look forward to!

Though, even with her appetite, the large meals left the girl stuffed silly, sitting back on her seat and rubbing her tummy, rounded and bloated from being so packed. She let out a cute little burp before licking her lips and fingers clean.

"A healthy appetite, just like her mom," the large woman said warmly, as her dad volunteered to escort the overfed little girl to bed for the night.
14433111.title: Dinnertime!

choices: Her parents find her like that the next morning.
She wakes up again before her parents get up, and has time to clear the evidence
144331111.content:
Cali was sitting at the dining room table, but there was no food on it - and neither her mom nor dad were anywhere to be seen. She blinked a few times, confused, glancing around the room. Where were her parents? Why was she sitting at the table if not for a meal?

She felt a breeze and looked down, realising suddenly that she was naked. Her pudgy, pale body was completely unclothed, oversized belly sitting comfortably on her soft thighs, which themselves sat on the cool wood of the chair. Cali bit her lip, glancing furtively around the dining room again. Wh-why wasn't she wearing anything?! She wasn't a particularly self-conscious girl, but it'd be super awkward if mom caught her hanging around the dining room without any clothes on.

And then, her belly spoke.
"Feed... meee..." the faint voice came from her midsection, barely audible. Cali's eyes widened in shock and she stared down at her bloated tummy, mouth hanging open.
"Feed... me!" the voice came again, a little louder this time, too loud for her to pretend she hadn't heard it.
"A-are you my tummy?" she directed the question down at her own body, hardly able to accept that this was happening. Was this a miracle? Mommy always said that miracles were wonderful things that couldn't be explained, and she definitely couldn't explain this. Whether it was wonderful though...

"Feed me!" her stomach bellowed, and suddenly with a sound like tearing paper it split open across her belly button to reveal a salivating, gnashing mouth. "FEED ME!"
Cali screamed, falling off the chair and trying to crawl away from her own torso. She scrabbled across the floor on her back, eyes wide and staring as she tried to comprehend the gaping maw now dividing her midsection.
Her brain kicked into gear for a second and she leaped to her feet, stumbling to the fridge and yanking it open. She reached in and began grabbing everything she could reach - slices of ham, eggs, milk, butter - and dumping it onto the floor. Then she collapsed down next to the pile and began unwrapping, unpeeling, unpacking, before flinging everything she could into the crunching mouth on her belly.
It slurped it all down - ready meals or ingredients, raw or cooked, sweet and sour and salty all swallowed down by the ravenous mouth in its insatiable quest for satisfaction. Before long, everything was gone, all the food Cali could find obliterated; and still the mouth was hungry.

"FEED ME!" it roared, and Cali burst into frantic tears.
"I can't! I've given you everything! I can't feed you any more!" she pleaded with it. There was a brief silence, and then...
"THEN I'LL JUST HAVE TO EAT YOU INSTEAD" it thundered, and began opening wider and wider, taking up more and more of her body. In seconds the mouth had encompassed her, the impossibility of the situation coming second to her terror as sharp teeth snapped shut over her head, cutting off her horrified screams once and for all.


And then she woke up on the kitchen floor, shivering and shaking. Her pyjamas were stained and damp, and as she glanced around she saw dozens of empty food packets littering the tiled floor. With trembling hands she yanked the front of her top open, tearing the buttons off in her haste, but where the terrible mouth had been only moments before there was now just the smooth white flesh of her swollen belly.
Unspeakably relieved, she lay back again on the cool tiles and fell immediately asleep.
144331111.title: The Mouth

choices: Her parents come down, having no clue anything happened.
Her parents come down, noticing her top.
1443311112.content:
It wasn't till early morning when Cali woke up again. This sleep was dreamless, which she was a bit thankful for after that nightmare. She had no idea how that happened, and it never occurred to her that it could possibly be from all that ice cream before bed.

She blinked as she remembered the mess of empty food packets and boxes on the ground in front of her. She knew for a fact that her parents wouldn't be happy to see her in such a state.

Assuming they weren't awake yet, she quickly got to work cleaning up the mess, throwing the trash in the bin and cleaning herself up as much as she could.

Her top was still ruined from the buttons popped off it, but other than that, there was no evidence.

Aside from the food stains on her pyjamas anyway.

Cali smirked at her work, and gave her grumbling belly a loving rub. All she had to do was wait for breakfast.
1443311112.title: Early Awakening

choices: "You're going to have to go away for a while."
"Some people are going to come and stay with us."
14433111121.content:
Before long, Cali could hear the tread of her parents' slippers on the stairs, and a moment later they entered the kitchen together. Cali was already sitting smartly at the kitchen table, trying her best to look innocent.

"Oh, Cali, you're up early," her mom said in surprise - normally her pampered daughter wouldn't be sighted until at least ten, yet here she was at eight sharp! "Couldn't sleep?"

"Um, yeah, something like that," Cali mumbled, folding her arms across her body in an attempt to disguise the damage to her top, "Uh mom, I'm hungry," she attempted to deflect her parents attention, "Could you make me some breakfast please?"

Her mom did a double take. Her daughter asking politely for something and not just demanding it? What on earth had happened? She never really minded when Cali acted spoiled - it was an inevitable side effect of pampering the young girl quite as much as she did - but she had to admit that hearing the word 'please' coming from her daughter's mouth for the first time in years was quite an experience. And these feelings of gratitude weren't going to make what had to come next any easier...
She nodded significantly at her husband, then pottered off to make her daughter a lovely big breakfast.

Cali watched in confusion as her dad walked slowly around the table and pulled himself out the chair opposite to her, and sat down in it with a little sigh. She stared at him anxiously as he seemed to be working himself up to something big...
14433111121.title: News over Breakfast

choices: Cali is hungry enough to forget her mood - for the moment...
She's still sulking too much to do anything, even eat late-breakfast.
144331111211.content:
Cali was sulking. In her eight years of life, if she hadn't wanted something, it hadn't happened. As long as she wailed for long enough, thrashed her arms, cried and sobbed and whined, then eventually her parents would cave and she'd get her way. When they'd tried to limit TV to only five hours a day - when she didn't want that nurse's appointment - when she really, really wanted that pink dress - every single time, they'd give up and let her have what she wanted.

Every single time except now.
She'd bawled her eyes out, smashed her mom's favourite chinaware, punched her father in the knees, torn the rest of the buttons off her shirt, stomped her feet, yelled that she hated both of them, beaten her fists on the floor until she was red in the face - and yet she was sitting in the back of the car headed to her Auntie Aida's nonetheless.

Her parents were absolutely resolute; she was going to go and stay with her aunt and cousins for a while, and nothing she could do would change their minds. For exactly how long, they wouldn't say - or even why she was going, or where they would be in the meantime. They'd just waited until she'd bawled herself into exhaustion, then her dad had picked her up (with some difficulty - she wasn't exactly a light child) and carried her to the car, where he'd buckled her securely into her carseat. Her mom had brought her breakfast, which Cali had immediately flung right back into her face; something she was now regretting three hours of driving later as her tummy was beginning to rumble more and more loudly.

However, she was sulking. No matter how greedy or hungry she might be, sulking took precedence, so she absolutely refused to say a word. As far as she was concerned, she was never speaking to her parents ever again. Her arms were folded resolutely over her pudgy chest, shoulders raised, eyes red and puffy from crying. She was still wearing her pyjama top, now hanging completely open at the front, but she was in such a mood that she didn't even care.

She was just trying to think of another word that rhymed with 'hate' for a new song about her parents, when the sound of the car's tires on gravel alerted her to the fact that her journey was finally over. The car slowed to a stop, and her father opened the door for her and began unbuckling her from her car seat.
"I'm sorry, princess, but this is the only way," he said, looking upset. She wouldn't even look at him though as she climbed out of the car.


Auntie Aida's house was a modest, detached property, all red-brick and white-framed windows. She scowled at it - right then, it could have been a beautiful fairytale mansion and she'd have hated it. In front of the house stood three people, one of which she recognised as her Aunt Aida. An aged, crow-like woman, she wore a rather tiny pair of spectacles on a rather large nose. Next to her stood a boy aged perhaps 15 or 16, then beside him two girls. One looked around her age, the other a couple of years younger.

Her parents were already greeting Aida, hugging and shaking hands. Cali hung back behind them, not wanting to show any interest in the people who would be her new family.
"Sorry, Cali's in a bit of a mood," she heard her mom explaining tearfully, "We had to spring this on her unexpectedly."
"That's quite all right, Rachel," Aida replied, embracing her sister, "It's perfectly reasonable to be upset given the circumstances." She smiled over at Cali, "Come and say hello, dear. It's not going to be as bad as you think, I'm sure."

Reluctantly, Cali trotted forwards, and was almost immediately pulled into an embrace by her aunt. The older woman's bony body managed to dig into her own soft one in about a dozen places, and she was extremely pleased when Aida eventually pulled back and let her free.
"Let me introduce you to everyone, dear," Aida said, gesturing first to the teenage boy, "This is Aiden, my oldest. He's a good lad, helps me with things since my husband passed away. He's used to dealing with his little sisters so I'm sure you'll get along fine."
She pointed next at the girl who looked around Cali's age, "This is Beth. She's eight, like you; I'm sure you two are going to be firm friends in no time."
Cali doubted that. Just about the only things she liked were music and TV, and she loathed just about every type of sport. This girl was not only wearing a soccer jersey, she was also wearing a baseball cap and wearing running shoes; Cali hated her already.
Finally, Aunt Aida waved at the smallest girl, "And this is Mel, my youngest. She's six."
Mel waved at Cali excitably, looking delighted by the entire situation.

"Now, are you hungry dear? I've got some food prepared inside for you if you are."
144331111211.title: Introductions

choices: ...healthy food?!
Something else?
1443311112111.content:
Cali was about to bark a defiant 'no' to Aunt Aida, but the sheer mention of food reminded her of how she had unwisely turned down breakfast earlier, and that her tummy was not happy about it.

Her expression softened as her stomach growled, almost encouraging her to accept the offer. She let out a stubborn sigh. "Okay."

Aunt Aida smiled and ushered her kids in, and Cali's parents grabbed her into a hug before she could follow.
"We're really sorry, princess," her dad muttered, "but it's just for a little while. We're sure you'll love it here."
"Hmph," was all Cali could muster.
Her mother sighed and planted a kiss on her forehead. "We're not leaving you here forever, okay? We'll be back."

Once the lukewarm goodbyes were taken care of and Cali's parents were gone, she trudged into Aunt Aida's house. It was neatly decorated, with some photos of Aida and her family. Some were group photos, some were alone and holding trophies or holding medals. She didn't care enough at the moment to look into them further.

Though, entering the kitchen and spotting the sizeable fridge helped her spirits just a little bit.
"Your food's just in here," Aida said, opening the fridge and pulling out a plate of...
1443311112111.title: Late Breakfast

choices: Mel comes in, having followed them upstairs.
Beth strikes up a conversation with her, and seems surprisingly friendly.
14433111121111.content:
Cali's lip curled visibly as she saw what Auntie Aida was expecting her to eat. A soggy plate of salad leaves, thinly sliced tomato, cucumber pieces and sugar snap peas, topped by a lonely piece of boiled chicken breast... for a girl used to adult-sized meals of fast food all to herself, it was mockery.
"You're kidding, right?" she asked, looking at the healthy meal with visible disgust.
Aunt Aida raised a solitary eyebrow.

"I wasn't. I take it you're not a fan of salad?"

"I'm not a fan of rabbit food!" Cali said, turning red again as she geared up for another tantrum. As if this day wasn't already the worst! "I want pizza. Or- or a burger!"
A flicker of a frown cast its shadow over Aida's face, but almost at once it was replaced by an indulging smile.
"Well we don't really eat that kind of thing ourselves, but I'll see what I can do, alright? Now how about you and Beth head upstairs and take a look at your room while I get something sorted for you, hmm?" The two locked eyes for a minute. Cali wanted to continue making demands so that she'd have an excuse to keep sulking, but it seemed Aida was more concerned with keeping the peace than sticking to principle. Well... that could work for her.

Eventually, Cali nodded her head. If Auntie Aida was this much of a pushover, maybe this unexpected trip wouldn't be as bad as she had feared after all.
She was still feeling fairly irritable though - a state only exacerbated by her rumbling, hungry stomach - so she took the opportunity to slam the door as she followed Beth out of the room.


The moment she was out of earshot, Aiden turned to his mother, eyes flashing with righteous indignation.
"Mom, why are we doing this? The kid's a brat!" he exclaimed, "Best case scenario she makes our lives miserable the whole time she's here - worst case her attitude rubs off on Beth and Mel and she makes our lives miserable for years."

Aunt Aida shook her head, the smile dropping from her face.
"I know. But I promised my sister I'd look after her. She shouldn't be here for too long; can't you put up with her for a little while?" she pleaded apologetically, "Maybe we can even straighten out her attitude a bit along the way, send her back to her parents a little better than how she came."

Now it was Aiden's turn to shake his head.
"You've started us off on the wrong foot then already. You should'a made her eat the salad. Kid obviously isn't gonna starve any time soon, it'd probably do her good."
His mother sighed deeply.
"Maybe you're right, but she needs to trust someone around here. At least we can let her eat what she wants for the first few days, just to ease her in. This is a big change for her as well, remember."

"Fine," Aiden grumbled, grinding his teeth, "She'd better not give my little sisters any bad ideas though, or I'll, I'll..." he trailed off, not entirely sure what he'd do. He could only hope she wasn't going to be too bad an influence on the household...


Meanwhile upstairs, Cali was discovering yet another bad thing in a day of bad things - she wasn't going to get her own room; or even, for that matter, her own bed. She was sharing a bunk bed with Beth, and faced with the prospect of a dozen different soccer players grimacing down on her every night from their posters as she went to sleep, her mood was darker than ever. Before she could demand they were taken down though...
14433111121111.title: Brat

choices: Cali agrees, actually starting to like Beth a little.
Cali disagrees? Something else happens?
144331111211112.content:
As Beth showed Cali her room, she began running through a plan in her head. She was warned that her cousin might be a bit...moody, but she was used to Mel having tantrums, so it didn't bug her that much.

The best thing she could try to do was try to find something in common with her.
"So, Cali," she spoke up, smiling at her, "which bunk do you want? I'm cool either way."

Cali was about to bark that she wanted the top bunk, but climbing that little ladder didn't sound fun. "I'll...have the bottom one." She muttered.

"Alright," Beth said, still smiling, "so, what do you like to do?"

Except eat, she thought dryly.

"Watch TV, eat, play video games," Cali listed, deadpan.

Beth blinked at the last point. Something they both liked? "Video games? What kinds?"

"RPGs, platformers, fantasy, stuff like that." Her eyes widened ever so lightly at the sight of the TV in the room, with a few game consoles attached to it.

"Nice! Me too!" Beth grinned, and pointed to her TV. "Wanna play something?"
144331111211112.title: Breaking the ice

choices: It isn't - she demands more food!
It's enough - just.
1443311112111121.content:
Reluctant as she was to abandon her cherished prejudice against sporty people, Cali had to admit that Beth seemed alright after all. The other girl was adept at video games - almost as good as Cali herself - and seemed happy and friendly despite Cali's admittedly abrasive attitude, playing down her own victories and lauding Cali's. By the time Aunt Aida called them down for breakfast (now probably late enough to be called lunch) she was starting to feel that this stay away might actually be fun after all.

The two girls hurried down the stairs towards the kitchen, a starving Cali in the lead. Her rumbling stomach had become louder and louder as they had played their game, her gut so used to constantly digesting food that it was made miserable by even this temporary deprivation. She burst into the kitchen, and was thoroughly delighted to see several boxes of takeaway pizza sitting on the table.

"I decided to treat us all, since it's your first day here. I'm afraid our meals aren't usually so unhealthy," Aunt Aida began to explain, but Cali wasn't remotely listening. She'd already wrenched open one of the boxes, grabbed a thick slice of greasy pizza from within and was stuffing it into her mouth. Aida, Mel, Beth and Aiden all looked on with mixed awe, disgust and fascination as she swallowed it down with nary a chew, oil and tomato sauce dripping from her chin to further stain her already ruined pyjamas.

As the last of the slice disappeared into her overused mouth, Cali looked around and seemed to surprised to find everyone staring at her.
"Wha-?" she asked, mouth still full of pizza, "I wa' hungry!" She slid into a chair and took another slice of pizza, eating it only slightly slower than the last piece. Shrugging, the other members of the family sat down as well and began to dig in, though with far less enthusiasm than Cali. They weren't a health-crazy family by any means, but pizza for breakfast was still strange for them.

"I just hope this is enough for her..." Aiden muttered under his breath.
1443311112111121.title: Pizza

choices: Cali dreams...
Time passes...does anything change?
14433111121111212.content:
To Aiden's relief, as soon as her thick and heavily topped pizza was finished, Cali had slumped back in her chair, licking grease and sauce off her lips as she contentedly rested her hands on her bloated tummy.

A soft sigh escaped her, followed by a little burp. "That's more like it..."

Aida and her kids were still amazed at how this girl ate so much, and in such a messy manner. Did her parents teach her any manners at all?
Though, Aida decided to dare asking, "Had enough, dear?"

Cali gave her a small nod. "Yeah...um, thanks," she muttered, in a bit of a food-fuelled stupor.

A smile crossed her aunt's face from hearing that. "You're welcome, hun."

Aiden rolled his eyes, Mel was still wide-eyed in awe, and Beth almost looked impressed at how her cousin could eat as much as she did.

The rest of the evening went surprisingly well after that. Cali took a rest until she felt mobile enough to have another gaming session with Beth, who she had to begrudgingly admit was growing on her already thanks to them finding a mutual interest.

Later on in the night, it was time for bed, and Cali mentally praised herself for being smart enough to call the top bunk and let her sporty twig of a cousin take the ladder to the top one.

The girls said their goodnights to each other, Cali's a bit quieter and more reluctant, and then they both drifted off.
14433111121111212.title: It's enough - just.

choices: They do - and are woken the next morning by a delicious smell...
They bump into someone on the stairs!
144331111211112121.content:
That night, Beth was pulled suddenly from her dreams by the creaking of her bed's wooden frame, then a moment later by footsteps on the carpet. She raised herself up on one arm and squinted down into the room, spotting Cali wandering out of the door towards the stairs, mumbling something under her breath. She quickly slid onto the ladder and pursued, catching up to Cali as the chubbier girl entered the kitchen.

"Hey! Cali, what'cha doing? We're not supposed to be up this late," she whispered urgently, but Cali ignored her and headed straight for the fridge. Beth thought she was muttering something about a mouth under her breath, but it was so soft that she couldn't be sure. "Cali!" Beth grabbed the other girl by the arm, making her jump sharply. She blinked a few times, then looked around the kitchen, seeming surprised at where she was. "What are you doing here?" Beth asked, worried.

Cali bit her lip.
"Oh, um, hi Beth. I was just... just... just getting a midnight snack, y'know? I do it all the time back at home," Cali invented hastily. For some reason, she didn't want to admit her newfound sleepwalking tendencies just yet, "Do you want something?" she pulled open the fridge and grabbed the first thing she saw - a four pint carton of milk.

Beth seemed bemused.
"A midnight snack? I don't think mom would like that... she needs that milk to make her shakes tomorrow anyway..." she blathered anxiously, wringing her hands as Cali pulled the lid off and began chugging directly from the carton. Honestly, Cali wasn't a big fan of milk - especially semi-skimmed - but she wasn't thinking straight right then, trying only to cover up her most recent visitation by the belly-mouth.
After she'd drunk a fair amount, and now feeling quite sick, she shoved the milk into Beth's hands.
"There you go, your turn. Drink up," she said, wiping her mouth with her sleeve.

Beth's eyes widened.
"I can't! Mom'll be mad. We're not even supposed to be down here!"
Now Cali rolled her own eyes.
"Your mom'll just blame me anyway, you may as well," she said, now genuinely interested in whether she could convince the other girl break the rules, "And it tastes really good," she lied, trying her best not to look too queasy.

Slowly, Beth raised the carton to her mouth and took the tiniest sip; then immediately shoved it back into Cali's hands.
"I- I did it!" she squeaked excitably, "I did it!"
"Pff, barely," Cali mocked, passing the carton back to her, "Drink properly or it doesn't count."
With more confidence this time Beth drank, gulping down almost everything left in the carton. Then she put it hurriedly back in the fridge and slammed the door.
"I, uh, I feel kinda ill," she admitted, hands on her stomach. Normally completely flat, it was now bulging ever so slightly from all the milk. "Can we go back to bed now?"
"Uh, sure," Cali nodded. Her own belly made Beth look emaciated, a great bulge of flab that stuck out sharply from the rest of her body. Even it looked a bit more swollen than usual though. "Let's go back to bed..."
144331111211112121.title: Ravenous Dreams

choices: Groceries are needed!
Something happens during breakfast?
1443311112111121211.content:
Both girls slept soundly the rest of the night, Cali being spared another visit from the belly mouth. Even with the chubbier girl's light snoring, Beth also went undisturbed.

It wasn't until morning that both girls woke back up, though under much more pleasant circumstances. The always welcome smell of toast hung in the air.

Breakfast!

Both girls yawned and stretched out their limbs, and Cali lazily climbed out from the bottom bunk as Beth slid down the ladder. Both girls' bellies had slimmed a bit from the milk the night before, Beth back to looking slim and Cali still as round as ever.

Both girls greeted each other before getting dressed, Beth quickly getting into a soccer shirt and shorts while Cali lazily slid on comfy black pants and a pretty pink top, which both looked rather snug on her plump form.

Once all set up, they headed downstairs for breakfast.
1443311112111121211.title: Breakfast!

choices: The car's at the mechanics - they have to walk to the supermarket! Using legs!
Aiden has something to say to her - he corners her on the stairs.
14433111121111212111.content:
Beth watched, impressed, as Cali buttered yet another slice of toast - then added a thick layer of chocolate spread, then glazed it with honey. By the time she was done, the toppings were almost as thick as the toast itself. Evidently their little feast last night had done nothing to dent the chubby girl's appetite, the relish with which Cali pushed her creation into her hungry mouth quite intact.

Curious, Beth imitated the other girl. She grabbed a piece of toast and spread toppings on it as Cali had, then tasted it - and grimaced. It was sickly-sweet, thick enough to get stuck in her teeth and so sugary it seemed to burn her taste buds. There was a certain... tantalising aftertaste to it, though; she nibbled at it again, then a little more, and before she knew it it was completely gone. She could feel it sitting in her stomach, intensely filling. She'd only had one slice and she felt stuffed - Cali was on her fourth!

Just then though, Aunt Aida spoke.
"We're in need of some more groceries. If anyone would like to come and give me a hand, I would much appreciate it," she said, looking around the room. Immediately Mel volunteered, excited to visit the supermarket - then, to everyone's surprise, Cali's hand, smeared as it was with honey and chocolate spread, poked its way into the air.
"I'll come," she mumbled, mouth full.

"Well, thank you both," said Aida, looking impressed. "We're leaving in twenty minutes, so go and brush your teeth and get ready and we can set off."

Cali nodded. She was finally feeling full, and the new day had left her in a surprisingly good mood all things considered. However, that positive attitude was soon to be challenged...
14433111121111212111.title: Break Thee Fast

choices: The girls are ready, and they set out!
Mel attempts to bond with Cali.
144331111211112121112.content:
Mel rushed up the stairs to brush her teeth, and Cali lazily followed her while sucking and licking her fingers clean. She didn't usually feel like going out after a filling meal, but the idea of inserting her 'opinions' into Aida's shopping list was too tempting to ignore. A smirk crossed her chubby face at it.

"Hey." Aiden's voice piped up behind her, causing her to jump slightly as she was about to start climbing the stairs.
Smirk fading into a frown, she turned and looked up at him. "What?"
"I saw Beth eating that stuff after watching you," he muttered, so only Cali could hear, "do you know how much sugar that is?"
Cali just shrugged, looking rather unimpressed. "I didn't make her do anything."
"Good," he went on, "keep it that way, and don't give her or Mel any ideas."

After keeping his glare on her a few moments, he walked upstairs past her, leaving her blinking with confusion. The heck was his problem?

Deciding it didn't matter, she continued her slow trek up after him, aiming to get herself ready.
144331111211112121112.title: A Warning

choices: All this Food Makes Cali Hungry.
She gets her way and Mel buys All sorts of Junk food
1443311112111121211121.content:
"What a jerk" Cali thought as she climbed the stairs, pausing at the top to catch her breathe for a moment.

Her belly was getting pretty heavy, something that wasn't unwelcome by Cali, but it was something she would have to deal with.
